name: Rgrd
tagline: A R language package to make easy and fun play with Global Device Repositories
body:
### Welcome to Rgrd package. This packages helps you to interact with a ereuse.org Global Devide Repository (GRD). ### What this package does. Below some examples you can run without any installation:
* Get devices information from a GRD. [Get GRD Devices Data](https://www.getdatajoy.com/project/558808d6e272c638722d3bf9) ### Rgrd Manual Get introduced to this package using our [Rgrd manual](https://github.com/eReuse/Rgrd/blob/master/Rgrd-manual.pdf) ### How to manually download and install last version of this package Download it as a .zip or .tar.gz, decompress it, install on R a file with name Rgrd_[version].tar.gz ### How to install Rgrd package using devtools On R type: (after devtools package installation)

`library(devtools)`
`install_github("eReuse/Rgrd/Rgrd")`
### How to install a test version of this package On R type:

`install.packages("http://data.ereuse.org/packages/Rgrd_0.01.tar.gz", repos = NULL, type="source")` ### How start with this package On R type: (after installation on your R)

`library(Rgrd)`
`url <- "http://sandbox.ereuse.org/api/devices/"`
`data <- getDevices(url)`
`result <- data$result`
